articles.author: Andrew Griffin
articles.title: Alien life probably could not thrive in Martian water, researchers say - The Independent
articles.description: Findings could prove good news for those hoping to explore Mars' surface
articles.content:
Salty pockets of water are probably commonly found on Mars  but would not serve as homes for alien life, scientists have found.
The new research modelled the Martian atmosphere in an attempt to understand whether those briney pockets have the right condition… [+5919 chars]

articles.title: Initial Upper Palaeolithic Homo sapiens from Bacho Kiro Cave, Bulgaria - Nature.com
articles.description: Direct dates for human remains found in association with Initial Upper Palaeolithic artefacts at Bacho Kiro Cave (Bulgaria) demonstrate the presence of Homo sapiens in the mid-latitudes of Europe before 45 thousand years ago.
articles.content:
• 1.Hublin, J.-J. The modern human colonization of western Eurasia: when and where? Quat. Sci. Rev. 118, 194210 (2015).
  • 2.Kuhn, S. L. & Zwyns, N. Rethinking the initial Upper Paleolithic. Quat. Int. 347, 2938 (2014).

articles.author: Katyanna Quach
articles.title: There's a world out there with a hexagon vortex over its pole packed with hydrocarbon ice crystals. That planet is Saturn - The Register
articles.description: Yet again, science reality is better than science fiction
articles.content:
The giant hexagon-shaped storm raging atop Saturns North Pole is made out of frozen hydrocarbon ice suspended in seven hazy layers stacked on top of one another, according to a study published in Nature Communications on Friday.
The swirling six-sided wonder… [+2126 chars]

articles.author: By Ian Randall For Mailonline
articles.title: Ocean levels could rise as much as 4.2 feet by 2100 if global emissions targets are not achieved - Daily Mail
articles.description: A high-emission future could see the planet on track for 16.4 feet (5 metres) of average sea level rise by the year 2300 - exceeding International Panel on Climate Change projections.
articles.content:
Ocean levels could rise as much as 4.2 feet by 2100 if global emissions targets are not achieved and the Earth's surface warms by another 6.3°F (3.5°C), a study found. 
This would put the planet on track for 16.4 feet (5 metres) of average sea level rise by … [+5482 chars]

articles.description: Pools and gyms are yet to be mentioned in the PM's plans.
articles.content:
It goes without saying, swimming is great for runners - it's an amazing form of cross training for those training for a half marathon or marathon, plus can help injured runners recover faster.

articles.author: Aylin Woodward
articles.title: Stunning Fossil Reveals Brutal Squid Attack From 200 Million Years Ago - ScienceAlert
articles.description: A squid-like creature attempted to strangle a fish 200 million years ago. Both animals died during the attack, and were fossilized together.
articles.content: About 200 million years ago, a brutal underwater attack took place in the Atlantic. A squid-like creature, armed with 10 tentacles studded with hooks, swam up to a prehistoric fish. The predator wrapped its long arms around the fish's head and crushed its sku… [+2750 chars]

articles.title: Scientists Find The First Animal That Doesn't Need Oxygen to Survive - ScienceAlert
articles.description: Some truths about the Universe and our experience in it seem immutable. The sky is up. Gravity sucks. Nothing can travel faster than light. Multicellular life needs oxygen to live. Except we might need to rethink that last one.
